description: From Middle English gentilly, gentlych, gentilliche, equivalent to gentle +â€Ž -ly, with *-lely simplified to -ly by haplology.

adverbs.description: gently (comparative gentlier or more gently, superlative gentliest or most gently)

definitionGroups.group: In a manner characterized by gentleness

entries.meaning: Without strong force or quickness: softly, lightly.
In a gentle manner; to a gentle degree.
Quietly: without much noise or motion.
(historical) From a gentle or high-class family.
(obsolete) In the manner of one of gentle birth; in a manner that reflects the traditional virtues of the gentry: courteously, nobly.
